sample_screenshots.caption: Intro: The members of the band are introduced

title: Wakusei Woodstock: Funky Horror Band

description: NFL's Greatest is an FMV football coaching simulation featuring two of the most popular teams in NFL history: the San Francisco 49ers and the Dallas Cowboys. Both teams are represented by clips from 25 years of NFL archive footage. The game is quite simple to play: each team chooses a play, then footage is played showing the outcome of the selected choices and the in-game display is updated to reflect the new standing. It is possible for a single player to be the coach of either team, for two players to go head-to-head, or to watch the computer select plays for both teams -- just like watching a real football game!
title: NFL's Greatest: San Francisco vs. Dallas 1978-1993

description: Aisle Lord is a 3D dungeon RPG in the tradition of western RPGs such as Wizardry and Might and Magic, though the story and character progression is much closer to Japanese style RPGs with a fixed cast that levels up automatically. The entire game, including towns and building interiors, is explored from a 3D third-person perspective; individual rooms and transitional areas are navigated in a point-and-click adventure game style. Battles play out in a semi-active fashion, with the player giving each character specific commands, which they will follow until instructed to do otherwise.

sample_screenshots.caption: The high priestess gives us our task

title: Aisle Lord

description:
Cyborg 009 is a side-scrolling platform action game based on the famous manga and anime series created by Shōtarō Ishinomori. The story begins with Joe (009) and France (003) encountering a mysterious young girl who seems to have some connection with the evil organization Black Ghost. The player controls Joe, who must use his cyborg super-speed and a powerful laser pistol to fight his way through Black Ghost's forces and get to the bottom of this mystery.

The platform stages are interspersed with cinematic cutscenes, much like Riot's own Valis series. The game also features the main voice cast from the 1979 animated version, and even music from the original series.

sample_screenshots.caption: In this level, you're running down a street automatically and must dodge/blast away everything on the way.

title: Cyborg 009

description:
Wondermega Collection was a sample disc containing four CD+G karaoke songs and the following games:

  • Paddle Fighter
  • Flicky
  • Pyramid Magic
  • Quiz Scramble

This CD was exclusively bundled with the Victor-branded Wondermega hardware in Japan.
title: Wondermega Collection

description: Warau Salesman (The Laughing Salesman) is a Japanese-style adventure game based on the manga & anime of the same title by Fujiko Fujio A., a black humor series that plays off human weakness, carelessness, and stupidity for comic effect. The game features three unrelated episodes, each focusing on a different character, and each with multiple endings... though none of them could really be described as "good". The game proceeds mostly in standard adventure game style, with the only real interaction being dialogue choices or clicking on objects to investigate them, though there are a handful of minigames sprinkled throughout that will also affect the story outcome.
title: Warau Salesman

description: Jangō World Cup is a digital version of the popular competitive table game mahjong, and part of the long-running Jangō series. The main mode is the so-called World Cup mode, where a wide array of opponents from all over the world, each with their own distinct play style, must defeated. The game also includes a free play mode where the player can set up a match with any of the available computer opponents. One special feature of the game is that it tracks play information for each registered player, and even gives the option to play against a computerized recreation of other players based on their records.
title: Jangō World Cup

description: This disc is an interactive Sega CD rendition of Note!'s chiptune album Color Mechanica. It features glitchy visuals and a sci-fi setting. Presented as a set of interactive light shows, the player is able to control the visuals and overlay extra sounds. With a second controller, two players can interact with the light show at once. In addition, it contains an FMV music video for the track Bearmode Transmission and a variety of extra hidden features.

sample_screenshots.caption: She has a long dance routine
The final song features the mysterious machine from the album cover
She leans down to say something to the performer...
FMVs open with this cute Laserdisc-style "PLAY" screen
Each song features a floating animated sigil

title: Color Mechanica

description:
Centered around the Jaguar XJ220 car type, the player picks a two-man team from a selection of nine to participate in three different game modes:

  • The Gran Prix mode has a total of 16 different race tracks played sequentially for the highest rank on the leaderboard against nine opponents. A qualifying race win earns the player money to repair and modify the chosen team’s car. The game ends if repair funds run out.
  • The World Tour mode similar to the first mode, but allows the player to select the next racetrack in any of 16 countries, the catch being added travel costs.
  • The Free Practice mode gives the player an opportunity to try out any of the 32 racetracks with no qualifying required, no repair costs and no opponents.

A track editor also exists for players to customize their own racetracks.

sample_screenshots.caption: Options screen. You can pick manual/automatic, mph/kph, etc.
Music is selected before a race in a CD player interface.

title: Jaguar XJ220

description:
A-Rank Thunder Tanjouhen is an adventure game following the story of Yutaka Ran. He begins the story waking up with no memory. However, he quickly finds out that he was not only captured, but turned into a superweapon, able to harness electricity in moments of extreme duress. Now he must use his powers to find a way to stop those who would use him in their plans.

A-Rank Thunder Tanjouhen has a strong focus on narrative, and its mechanics are designed to facilitate that. Players progress through the story by speaking with key NPCs, and occasionally fight combatants through a rudimentary card-based battle system. The most notable aspect of play is the Live Interactive Picture system: during dialogue, the player may be asked to manage Yutaka's emotional state through dialogue choices. He will perform better or worse in the combat systems depending on the player's choices.
title: A-Rank Thunder Tanjōhen

description:
Mahō no Shōjo: Silky Lip is a Japanese-style adventure game with light RPG elements, structured like an animated TV series. Each of the 11 chapters consists of an opening sequence, two acts separated by a commercial break eyecatch, and ending credits. The game follows the adventures of the young girl Lip Ohtake, who secretly can transform into the magical girl hero Silky Lip.

The gameplay consists of three main modes. The main adventure mode allows the player to control Lip and explore the school and other locations from a top-down perspective; she can speak with other characters, investigate objects, and use or give items to solve simple puzzles. Conversations with other characters sometimes switch to conversation mode; in this mode, the player does not select specific things to say, but rather selects from a list of emotions such as "angry", "sad", or "happy" to determine each response, and these choices affect the characters' relationships and how each chapter plays out. Finally, certain events initiate battle mode, in which the player can command Lip to use various magic spells, attempt to speak with her opponent, or run from battle; these battle sequences have no lose condition, though the outcome can affect the progression of the story.
title: Mahō no Shōjo: Silky Lip

description: Dai Hōshin Den is a Japanese-style RPG loosely based on the famous 16th-century Chinese novel Fengshen Yanyi (Investiture of the Gods), with the player controlling Taigong Wang on a divine mission to defeat the treacherous King Zhou and restore peace to the human world. It is a turn-based story-driven game in the mold of contemporary Dragon Quest or Final Fantasy games, with fixed character experience growth and party makeup as the story progresses; one notable feature is the "semi auto-battle" system, where the player can choose to issue commands directly to party members or to allow the game to decide which actions to take.
title: Dai Hōshin Den

description:
Tenbu: Mega CD Special is a real-time simulation game set in the Three Kingdoms era of Chinese history, in which the player's goal is to conquer and unify all of China. Unlike most games set in this time period such as the famous Romance of the Three Kingdoms, it is not based on the classic Chinese novel of the same name, but rather is based on the historical Records of the Three Kingdoms which was in turn the basis of famous the novel.

Gameplay consists primarily of managing resources and diplomacy through a nested menu system, allocating soldiers and other resources to generals across the regions controlled by the player. There are a total of six scenarios to play, and 10 different playable generals to choose from.
title: Tenbu: Mega CD Special
